markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) NOTE--THIS IS A TIE STATION FOR FREEPORT INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT.  THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE NORTHWEST END OF GRAND BAHAMA ISLAND, IN WEST END, JUST NORTH OF THE SOUTH END OF A SEAWALL ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE CHANNEL, WEST OF THE MAIN CHANNEL, AND ADJACENT TO THE MARINA OFFICE AND WAREHOUSE.  OWNERSHIP--JACK TAR MARINA.  CONTACT CAPTAIN RICHARD RINEHART FOR PERMISSION TO OCCUPY THIS STATION AND ACCESS THROUGH THE LOCKED GATE.  PHONE 809-346-6259.  THE ESCORT AT THE TIME OF THIS VISIT WAS JOE HEPBURN.  THE AREA CODE WILL CHANGE TO 242 IN MAY OR JUNE OF 1996.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AND FISHING HOLE ROAD (ALSO KNOWN AS QUEENS HIGHWAY) , GO NORTH, THEN NORTHWEST, ON FISHING HOLE ROAD FOR 5.47 KM (3.40 MI) TO A T-JUNCTION. TURN RIGHT, NORTHWESTERLY, PASSING THROUGH THE SETTLEMENT OF EIGHT MILE ROCK FOR 21.25 KM (13.20 MI) TO A PAVED ROAD RIGHT AND A SIGN WEST END, HOME OF HOSPITALITY.  TURN RIGHT, NORTHWESTERLY, ON THE ROAD FOR 6.52 KM (4.05 MI) TO A LOCKED GATE AT JACK TAR MARINA.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE, NORTHWEST, FOR 1.28 KM (0.80 MI) TO THE STATION JUST AFTER PASSING THROUGH A SECOND GATE. THE STATION IS SET FLUSH IN THE TOP OF THE SEAWALL PROJECTING 30 CM ABOVE THE GROUND.  IT IS 55.3 M (181.4 FT) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE WEST GATEPOST AT THE SECOND MARINA ENTRANCE, 13.7 M (44.9 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF A BOAT SLIP, 12.7 M (41.7 FT) SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE MARINA OFFICE AND WAREHOUSE BUILDING, 9.7 M (31.8 FT) NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF A 0.55 M (1.80 FT) SQUARE STEEL ELECTRICAL COVER, 9.5 M (31.2 FT) SOUTH OF THE EAST GATEPOST OF A GATE FROM THE SEAWALL TO THE BUILDING, AND 2.6 M (8.5 FT) NORTH OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE SEAWALL.  DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AUG
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN THE FOOTINGS OF SMALL/MEDIUM STRUCTURES
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) NOTE--THIS IS A TIE STATION FOR FREEPORT INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT.  THE STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE NORTHWEST END OF GRAND BAHAMA ISLAND, IN THE BOOTLE BAY AREA, ABOUT 0.9 KM (0.55 MI) SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST SHORE OF THE ISLAND, IN THE BOOTLE BAY AREA, IN LOW BRUSH AND ADJACENT TO THE BC-4 BUILDING.  OWNERSHIP--GRAND BAHAMA PORT AUTHORITY, P.O. BOX F40916, FREEPORT INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, FREEPORT, GRAND BAHAMA. WELLINGTON G.  MOULTRIE IS CHIEF OPERATIONS OFFICER.  PHONE 809-352-6020, FAX 809-352-9432.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AND FISHING HOLE ROAD (ALSO KNOWN AS QUEENS HIGHWAY) , GO NORTH, THEN NORTHWEST, ON FISHING HOLE ROAD FOR 5.47 KM (3.40 MI) TO A T-JUNCTION.  TURN RIGHT, NORTHWESTERLY, PASSING THROUGH THE SETTLEMENT OF EIGHT MILE ROCK FOR 20.12 KM (12.50 MI) TO A PAVED ROAD RIGHT ABOUT 0.24 KM (0.15 MI) BEFORE REACHING BERNIES RESTAURANT AND LOUNGE ON THE LEFT.  TURN RIGHT, NORTHEAST, ON THE ROAD FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS SET FLUSH NEAR THE SOUTH CORNER OF THE TOP OF A 2.1 M (6.9 FT) SQUARE CONCRETE FOUNDATION PROJECTING 45 CM WITH 03992 STENCILED ON THE SOUTHEAST SIDE (BARELY LEDGIBLE) . IT IS 42.0 M (137.8 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 19.7 M (64.6 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTH CORNER OF A 3.25 M (10.66 FT) X 4.7 M (15.4 FT) CONCRETE BLOCK BUILDING, 15.05 M (49.38 FT) WEST OF THE WEST CORNER OF A 6.2 M (20.3 FT) TALL X 1.3 M (4.3 FT) SQUARE (AT THE BASE) OBELISK HOLDING STATION BC-4 WEST END 1960, 11.05 M (36.25 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST OF WEST CORNER OF A 3.25 M (10.66 FT) X 4.5 M (14.8 FT) BUILDING (BUILDING NUMBER 03052) , AND 1.13 M (3.71 FT) SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF A 2 INCH DIAMETER STEEL PIPE IN THE CENTER OF THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION.  DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AUG
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN THE FOOTINGS OF SMALL/MEDIUM STRUCTURES
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY BAHAMAS DEPT OF LAND + SURVEY 1970 (KJB) NOTE--THE STATION IS RECOVERED BY NGS AT THIS TIME.  BAHAMAS LANDS AND SURVEYS RECORDS SHOW THIS STATION WAS SET BY K.J.  BARRY IN APRIL 1970, WITH PUBLISHED HEIGHT ABOVE M.S.L.= 38.16, UNSPECIFIED DATUM.* NOTE--THIS IS A SECONDARY AIRPORT CONTROL STATION (SACS) .* THE STATION IS ON ELEUTHERA ISLAND, BAHAMAS, ABOUT 12 KM (7.45 MI) NORTHWEST OF GOVERNORS HARBOUR, AT THE GOVERNORS HARBOUR AIRPORT, SOUTHWEST OF QUEENS HIGHWAY, SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHERLY ENTRANCE TO THE AIRPORT TERMINAL, AND NEAR THE WEST FACE OF THE TOP OF A HILL ALONG QUEENS HIGHWAY.  OWNERSHIP--DEPARTMENT OF CIVIL AVIATION, P.O. BOX 975, NASSAU, BAHAMAS.  CONTACT CYRIL R.  SAUNDERS, AIRSPACE ATC MANAGER FOR PERMISSION TO OCCUPY THIS STATION, PHONE 809-37-72009, FAX 809-37-72116.  AIRPORT MANAGER IS DONALD FERNANDER, GOVERNORS HARBOUR AIRPORT, P.O.  GENERAL DELIVERY, GOVERNORS HARBOUR, BAHAMAS, PHONE 809-322-2321.* THE STATION IS LOCATED 52.5 M (172.2 FT) NORTHEAST OF THE FLAGPOLE ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF THE DOMESTIC TERMINAL, 37.5 M (123.0 FT) NORTH OF THE NORTH CORNER OF THE INTERNATIONAL TERMINAL, 13.8 M (45.3 FT) EAST SOUTHEAST OF THE EAST CORNER OF A WALL DIVIDING THE AIRPORT PARKING AREA, 8.0 M (26.2 FT) SOUTHWWEST OF THE CENTER OF QUEENS HIGHWAY, 4.45 M (14.60 FT) WEST SOUTHWEST OF A STEEL POST AT THE NORTHWEST END OF A GUARDRAIL AT THE AIRPORT ENTRANCE, AND 0.8 M (2.6 FT) SOUTH SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST SIDE OF THE CONCRETE WALL ALONG THE ENTRANCE ROAD.  THE STATION IS A PUNCH HOLE IN THE ROUNDED TOP OF A STEEL RON BETWEEN TWO STAMPED SURVEY DISKS (ONE IS STAMPED -LANDS AND SURVEYS-, THE OTHER IS STAMPED -BM 36 1970-) , SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE POST, 37 CM (14.5 IN) SQUARE AT BASE, TAPERING TO 22 CM (8.5 IN) SQUARE AT TOP, WITH STEEL RODS IN THE BASE OF THE CONCRETE POST DRILLED INTO BEDROCK.  THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE POST PROJECTS 30 CM (11.8 IN) ABOVE GRADE.  DESCRIBED BY DG AUG.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ELEUTHERA ISLAND, ABOUT 2 KM (1.25 MI) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF ROCK SOUND, BAHAMAS, ALONG THE CENTER OF THE SOUTHWEST SIDE OF A CURVE IN QUEENS HIGHWAY, JUST EAST OF THE EXTENSION OF RUNWAY END 27 OF THE ROCK SOUND INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, AND JUST OUTSIDE OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE AIRFIELD. OWNERSHIP--BAHAMAS GOVERNMENT, SURVEYING AND MAPPING SECTION, LANDS AND SURVEYS DEPARTMENT, P.O.  BOX N592, NASSAU, BAHAMAS.  MR.  RALPH H.  BRENNEN IS ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF LANDS AND SURVEYS.  PHONE 809-322-2565 OR 809-322-2328, FAX 809-322-5830.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AND THE ENTRANCE ROAD TO ROCK SOUND INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT (0.16 KM NORTH OF THE NEW ENTRANCE ROAD PRESENTLY UNDER CONSTRUCTION) , GO NORTH AND NORTHWEST, ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 0.28 KM (0.15 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT ACROSS THE HIGHWAY FROM A GRAVEL ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS A PUNCH HOLE IN THE TOP OF A STEEL ROD BETWEEN TWO SURVEY PLATES (ONE IS STAMPED LAND AND SURVEYS, THE OTHER IS STAMPED BM 64 1970) , SET IN THE TOP OF A 35 CM SQUARE CONCRETE POST TAPERING TO 22 CM AT THE TOP WITH STEEL RODS DRIVEN INTO THE GROUND.  IT IS ON THE EXTENSION OF THE CENTER OF THE GRAVEL ROAD, 11.3 M (37.1 FT) SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AND THE GRAVEL ROAD, 9.5 M (31.2 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE HIGHWAY, AND 2.0 M (6.6 FT) SOUTH OF A STEEL POST. DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AUG
markers.setting: undefinedUNSPECIFIED SETTING
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) NOTE--THIS IS A BENCHMARK TIE STATION FOR NASSAU INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON NEW PROVIDENCE ISLAND, NASSAU, BAHAMAS, ABOUT 6 KM (3.70 MI) SOUTHWEST OF THE NASSAU INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, BETWEEN SOUTH WEST ROAD AND A CHAIN-LINK FENCE ALONG THE SHORE OF THE ATLANTIC OCEAN, JUST WEST OF AND ACROSS FROM THE ENTRANCE ROAD TO THE ESSO MARKET TERMINAL THAT IS ADJACENT TO THE CLIFFTON PIER POWER STATION.  OWNERSHIP--BAHAMAS GOVERNMENT, SURVEYING AND MAPPING SECTION, LANDS AND SURVEYS DEPARTMENT, P.O. BOX N592, NASSAU, BAHAMAS. CONTACT MR.  RALPH H.  BRENNEN, ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF LANDS AND SURVEYS FOR AN ESCORT TO THIS STATION.  PHONE 809-322-2565, OR 809-322-2328, FAX 809-322-5830.  THE STATION IS A DATUM POINT ON A SURVEY PIN DRILLED INTO BEDROCK AND ADJACENT TO A SURVEY PLATE THAT IS STAMPED--BM NP 19 L S 1970--AND RECESSED 30 CM BELOW THE GROUND IN A 20 CM SQUARE CAST IRON BOX WITH A REMOVABLE LID SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 9.75 M (31.99 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE STEEL POST OF AN ESSO MARKET TERMINAL SIGN, 6.9 M (22.6 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE EAST END OF A CHAIN-LINK FENCE AT A SMALL BUILDING WITH TWO DOUBLE DOORS, 4.9 M (16.1 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF SOUTH WEST ROAD, AND 3.55 M (11.65 FT) EAST OF THE NORTHEAST ONE OF FOUR STEEL POSTS WITH A CHAIN PERIMETER AROUND AN ELECTRICAL VAULT WITH A DOUBLE DOOR. DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AUG                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY MERRICK AND COMPANY 2007 (KPK) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) NOTE THIS IS A TIE STATION FOR FREEPORT INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON GRAND BAHAMA ISLAND, ON THE NORTH EDGE OF FREEPORT, ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF QUEENS HIGHWAY, AND ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF A PINE TREE FOREST.  OWNERSHIP--GRAND BAHAMA PORT AUTHORITY, P.O.  BOX F40916, FREEPORT INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, FREEPORT, GRAND BAHAMA.  MAILING ADDRESS IS BOX 140939, CORAL GABLES, FLORIDA, 33114-0939.  WELLINGTON G.  MOULTRIE IS CHIEF OPERATIONS OFFICER. PHONE 809-352-2205, FAX 809-352-9432.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF AIRPORT ROAD AND THE MAIN ENTRANCE OF THE FREEPORT INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, WHICH IS 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) WEST OF THE AIRPORT EXIT ROAD, GO EASTERLY ON AIRPORT ROAD FOR 0.64 KM (0.40 MI) TO A ROUNDABOUT TURN. BEAR LEFT, NORTHERLY, GOING 3/4 AROUND FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) ENDING SOUTHERLY, PASSING GRAND BAHAMA HIGHWAY ON THE LEFT TO EAST MALL DRIVE.  CONTINUE AHEAD, SOUTH, ON EAST MALL DRIVE FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT, WEST, ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 0.56 KM (0.35 MI) TO A PAVED ROAD LEFT. CONTINUE WEST ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 1.77 KM (1.10 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 25 CM SQUARE CONCRETE POST SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 6.1 M (20.0 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE HIGHWAY, 7.9 M (25.9 FT) NORTH OF A POWER POLE, AND 1.5 M (4.9 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST.  DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AUG
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY BAHAMAS DEPT OF LAND + SURVEY 1980 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ELEUTHERA ISLAND, ABOUT 6 KM (3.70 MI) NORTHWEST OF THE GOVERNORS HARBOUR, 6 KM (3.70 MI) SOUTHEAST OF GOVERNORS HARBOUR AIRFIELD, ALONG THE SOUTHWEST SIDE OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AT THE TOP OF A GRADE ON THE HIGHWAY, AND NORTHEAST OF THE BOTTOM OF A LOW RISE.  OWNERSHIP--BAHAMAS GOVERNMENT, LANDS AND SURVEYS DEPARTMENT, P.O.  BOX N592, NASSAU, BAHAMAS.  CONTACT IS MR. RALPH H. BRENNEN, PHONE 809-322-2565 OR 2328.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AND THE NORTH ENTRANCE TO GOVERNORS HARBOUR AIRFIELD, PROCEED SOUTHWEST ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 2.1 KM (1.30 MI) TO THE U.S.  NAVY FACILITY (OWNED BY THE BAHAMA GOVERNMENT) TO THE PAVED ENTRANCE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE SOUTHEASTERLY ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 4.35 KM (2.70 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT. THE STATION IS A PUNCH MARK AT THE TIP OF TWO CONNECTED LINES ON THE DISK, SET IN THE TOP AF A 24 CM SQUARE CONCRETE POST SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND WITH STEEL RODS DRILLED INTO BEDROCK.  THE STATION IS 20.7 M (67.9 FT) NORTHWEST OF POWER POLE NUMBER 278 (HAS ONLY ONE WIRE) AND 19.3 M (63.3 FT) SOUTHEAST OF POWER POLE NUMBER 277 (HAS FOUR WIRES) , 5.8 M (19.0 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE HIGHWAY, AND 1.3 M (4.3 FT) NORTHEAST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1996)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (SER) RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 08 APR 1996 (SER-WCW) . RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL IMAGERY + MAPPING AGENCY 1999 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE FIELD THAT LIES BETWEEN BEEBE AVENUE AND POLLACK ROAD IN THE CENTRAL REGION OF AUTEC SITE 1, ANDROS ISLAND, BAHAMAS.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NORTH GATE PROCEED SOUTH ALONG BEEBE AVENUE 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO THE INTERSECTION OF BEEBE AVENUE AND THOMPSON.  CONTINUE SOUTH ON BEEBE AVENUE FOR 0.20 MI (0.32 KM) TO GRAVEL ROAD ON LEFT, JUST PAST THE WATER TOWER.  TURN LEFT (EAST) ON GRAVEL ROAD AND PROCEED 0.05 MI (0.08 KM), THEN TURN RIGHT (SOUTH) AND PROCEED 0.1 MI (0.16 KM) TO STATION IN CENTER OF OPEN FIELD.   THE STATION IS APPROXIMATELY 110 M (360.8 FT) NORTHEAST OF A POWER POLE LOCATED AT THE NORTHEASTERN PART OF THE INTERSECTION OF BEEBE AVENUE AND MAURY AVENUE, AND 97 M (318.2 FT) SOUTHEAST OF THE POWER POLE THAT IS NEAREST THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE NAVY ADMINISTRATION BUILDING.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD DMA BRASS DISK SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND STAMPED --- CENTER 1994 GGG.                               STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTORS 2009 (ND) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN A MAT FOUNDATION OR CONCRETE SLAB OTHER THAN
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SETTLEMENT OF ROCK SOUND, ALONG THE CENTER OF THE NORTHWEST SIDE OF A CURVE IN QUEENS HIGHWAY, AND ACROSS THE HIGHWAY FROM AN ESSO GAS STATION.  OWNERSHIP--BAHAMAS GOVERNMENT, SURVEYING AND MAPPING SECTION, LANDS AND SURVEYS DEPARTMENT, P.O. BOX N592, NASSAU, BAHAMAS.  MR.  RALPH H.  BRENNEN IS ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF LANDS AND SURVEYS.  PHONE 809-322-2565 OR 809-322-2328, FAX 809-322-5830.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AND THE ENTRANCE ROAD TO ROCK SOUND INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, GO SOUTHERLY ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO THE NEW AIRPORT ENTRANCE ROAD ON THE RIGHT (PRESENTLY UNDER CONSTRUCTION) .  CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 1.93 KM (1.20 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS A A PUNCH MARK AT THE TIP OF TWO CONNECTED LINES ON THE DISK, SET IN THE TOP OF A 25 CM SQUARE CONCRETE POST WITH STEEL RODS DRILLED INTO BEDROCK RECESSED 2 CM BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 26.6 M (87.3 FT) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE EAST LEG OF A SIGN FOR A LIQOUR STORE, 10.8 M (35.4 FT) NORTHEAST OF A POWER POLE WITH SIX POWER LINES, 6.2 M (20.3 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST OF, AND ABOUT 0.2 M (0.7 FT) LOWER THAN THE CENTER OF THE HIGHWAY, AND 2.8 M (9.2 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A POWER POLE WITH A STEEL WITNESS SIGN ATTATCHED. DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AU31.2 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE HIGHWAY, AND 2.0 M (6.6 FT) SOUTH OF A STEEL POST.  DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AUG

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL IMAGERY + MAPPING AGENCY 1999 STATION IS LOCATED ON GOLDING CAY EAST OF ANDROS ISLAND WHICH IS KNOWN AS SITE 4 OF AUTEC.  STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SOUTHEAST SIDE OF SITE 4 WEST OF THE FOOTPATH THAT CIRCLES THE ISLAND. EPOXIED FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF A CONCRETE PAD AND STAMPED --- GIP 1986 DET 4 GSS.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1951 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ELEUTHERA ISLAND ABOUT 12 KM (7.45 MI) NORTHWEST OF GOVERNORS HARBOUR, 2.1 KM (1.30 MI) SOUTHEAST OF GOVERNORS ISLAND AIRFIELD, ON TOP OF THE FIRST HILL APPROXIMATELY 100 M (328.1 FT) SOUTHEAST OF TWO SILVER SALT WATER TANKS AT THE SOUTH CORNER OF THE U.S.  NAVAL FACILTY (NOW OWNED BY THE BAHAMA GOVERNMENT) , IN LINE WITH THE CENTER OF THE NORTHEAST ONE OF TWO TANKS, AND UUPHILL AND SOUTHWEST OF A FRESH WATER RESERVOIR. OWNERSHIP--BAHMAS GOVERNMENT, LANDS AND SURVEYS, DEPARTMENT, P.O. BOX N592, NASSAU, BAHAMAS.  CONTACT IS MR.  RALPH H.  BRENNEN, ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF LANDS AND SURVEYS, PHONE 809-322-2328.  FOR ACCESS THROUGH THE LOCKED GATE TO THE STATION IS MR.  DONALD FERNANDER AIRPORT MANAGER.  PHONE 809-332-2321.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AND THE NORTH ENTRANCE TO GOVERNORS HARBOUR AIRFIELD, GO SOUTHWEST ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 2.1 KM (1.30 MI) TO THE PAVED ENTRANCE ROAD TO THE OLD U.S.  NAVY FACILITY ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT ON THE ENTRANCE ROAD FOR 0.64 KM (0.40 MI) TO THE GUARD BOOTH AND A LOCKED GATE.  PROCEED THROUGH THE GATE, PASSING A PAVED ROAD LEFT, CONTINUE DOWNHILL FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO A T-JUNCTION WITH A CONCRETE TRIANGLE WITH A LONE TREE IN THE CENTER. TURN RIGHT, SOUTHEAST, PASSING AROUND A BUILDING ON THE RIGHT TO THE SOUTH END OF THE BUILDING FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO A PAVED ROAD LEFT AND A DIM TRACK ROAD RIGHT.  CONTINUE UPHILL, SOUTHWEST, FOR ABOUT 60M, BETWEEN TWO BUILDINGS FOR 0.08 KM (0.05 MI) TO THE PARKING LOT END AT A BUILDING PERPINDICULAR TO THE OTHER TWO AND A PAVED ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT FOR ABOUT 15 M (49.2 FT) TO A DIM GRASS TRAIL RIGHT AT THE TOP OF THE RESERVOIR.  TURN RIGHT, SOUTHEAST ALONG THE TOP OF THE RESERVOIR FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO THE START OF A PAVED ROAD. FROM HERE WALK SOUTHEAST FOR ABOUT 15 M (49.2 FT) TO A FENCE, THEN SOUTHWEST AND UPHILL FOR ABOUT 50 M (164.0 FT) TO THE TOP OF A HILL, THEN TURN NORTHWEST ALONG THE TOP OF THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 30 M (98.4 FT) TO THE STATION.  THE STATION IS SET FLUSH IN CONCRETE IN THE CENTER TOP OF A 1.5 M (4.9 FT) SQUARE CONCRETE PAD SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.
markers.setting: undefinedOBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: THIS MONUMENT IS ASSOCIATED WITH CORS SITE 'CN14' LATEST INFORMATION INCLUDING POSITIONS AND VELOCITIES ARE AVAILABLE IN THE COORDINATE AND LOG FILES ACCESSIBLE BY ANONYMOUS FTP OR THE WORLDWIDE WEB.    https://geodesy.noaa.gov/corsdata/coord/coord_14    https://geodesy.noaa.gov/corsdata/station_log    https://geodesy.noaa.gov/CORS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ELEUTHERA ISLAND, ABOUT 8 KM (4.95 MI) SOUTH OF ROCK SOUND, BAHAMAS, ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF A GRAVEL TRAIL ROAD, NEAR THE TOP OF THE HIGHEST HILL IN THE VICINITY, AND IN AN AREA SURROUNDED BY SMALL TREES AND LOW BRUSH.  OWNERSHIP--BAHAMAS GOVERNMENT, SURVEYING AND MAPPING SECTION, LANDS AND SURVEYS DEPARTMENT, P.O.  BOX N592, NASSAU, BAHAMAS.  MR.  RALPH H.  BRENNEN IS ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF LANDS AND SURVEYS.  PHONE 809-322-2565 OR 809-322-2328, FAX 809-322-5830.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF QUEENS HIGHWAY AND THE ENTRANCE ROAD TO ROCK SOUND INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, GO SOUTHERLY ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR O.16 KM TO THE NEW ENTRANCE TO THE AIRPORT (PRESENTLY UNDER CONSTRUCTION) .  CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 2.7 KM (1.65 MI) TO THE JUNCTION OF A ONE-WAY STREET ON THE LEFT JUST BEFORE THE BAHAMAS ELECTRICITY CORPORATION ACCOUNTING AND COLLECTIONS OFFICE ON THE LEFT AND THE ROCK SOUND CLINIC ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE AHEAD, SOUTHERLY, ON QUEENS HIGHWAY FOR 8.45 KM (5.25 MI) TO A GRAVEL TRAIL ROAD ON THE LEFT ABOUT MIDWAY THROUGH A CURVE TO THE RIGHT IN THE HIGHWAY.  TURN LEFT, SOUTHEAST, FOR ABOUT 10 M, (32.8 FT) THEN SOUTH, ON THE GRAVEL TRAIL, ALONG A POWER LINE, FOR 0.8 KM (0.50 MI) TO THE TOP OF THE GRADE AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT JUST BEFORE THE NINTH POWER POLE.  THE STATION IS SET IN THE TOP OF A LARGE AREA OF BEDROCK WHICH HAS BEEN COVERED BY SAND AND GROWN OVER WITH VEGITATION AND RECESSED 30 CM BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 13.2 M (43.3 FT) SOUTHWEST OF, AND ACROSS THE TRAIL ROAD FROM THE NINTH POWER POLE FROM THE HIGHWAY, 8.22 M (26.97 FT) WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE TRAIL ROAD, AND 1.3 M (4.3 FT) WEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST. THE STATION IS PROTECTED BY THREE STEEL POSTS JOINED AT THE TOP, SET IN A TRIANGULAR FORM AND PROJECTING ABOUT 1 M.  (3.3 FT) IT IS 13.7 M (44.9 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CHAIN-LINK FENCE, 12.8 M (42.0 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE HIGHWAY, AND 10.3 M (33.8 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST OF A POWER POLE.  DESCRIBED BY D.G.  AUG
markers.setting: undefinedSET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL IMAGERY + MAPPING AGENCY 1999 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE EAST COAST OF ANDROS ISLAND AT AUTEC SITE 2, NORTH OF THE SITE BUILDINGS.   THE STATION IS 23.6 M (77.41 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A LONE DECIDUOUS TREE, 53.0 M (173.84 FT) SOUTHEAST OF THE S2 STS E6 WOODEN POLE AND 75.0 M (246.0 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF THE SITE 2 MICROWAVE TOWER.   THE STATION DISK IS CEMENTED FLUSH INTO THE CENTER OF A 1.8 M (5.90 FT) CONCRETE PAD.  THE MARK IS A NIMA BRASS DISK STAMPED --- RADAR O/S 1997.   THE STATION MARK WAS SET BY AUTEC FACILITIES ENGINEERING PERSONNEL IN DECEMBER 1997.                               STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTORS 2009 (ND) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL IMAGERY + MAPPING AGENCY 1999 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHERN HALF OF AUTEC SITE 3 (BIG WOOD CAY), ANDROS ISLAND, BAHAMAS AND 70 METERS SOUTHWEST OF THE MOST NORTHERLY OF THE WOODEN STS POLES (E6).   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE STS BUILDING AT SITE 3 PROCEED NORTH-NORTHEAST 253 M (830 FT) TO A CONCRETE PAD AND THE STATION IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PAD.   THE STATION IS A STANDARD NIMA BRASS DISK STAMPED --- S3 NORTH 2 1998 --- AND SET FLUSH IN THE CENTER OF A 2.44 M (8.00 FT) BY 2.44 M (8.00 FT) CONCRETE PAD THAT IS 0.25 M (0.82 FT) TALL.
